image.altText: Sam Mostyn poses for a selfie with primary school students. They're all smiling.

props.synopsis: Vowing to be a modern, optimistic and visible governor-general, Sam Mostyn has adopted a "culture of care" as a key focus of her term. So how has she done that over her first year in the job? And can she help Australia during these polarised times?

title.children: Inside the governor-general's first year of service and storytelling

image.altText: A man in a charcoal suit and glasses stands speaking behind a podium on a stage.

props.synopsis: The 2025 ACT Labor conference sees optimism about the party's achievements along with concern about the issues the public health system is facing.

title.children: ACT chief minister calls for more federal health funding

image.altText: a dark clouds covers the skyline of birdsville in queensland

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: A colourful photographic installation with one image of a man and one of a woman in the centre, with collages on either side.

props.synopsis: The minds behind iconic fashion house Romance Was Born, Anna Plunkett and Luke Sales, are the focus of a new photographic installation at the National Portrait Gallery in Canberra.

title.children: Gallery installation pays tribute to Aussie fashion house loved by celebs

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The court heard the Canberra man, who admitted putting spyware on a woman's phone, denied it when she asked if he had and told her she was paranoid.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for stalking woman, putting spyware on her phone

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: The administrators of Brindabella Christian College in Canberra's north say the school spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on a robot dog and an overseas trip while it may have been insolvent.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College likely insolvent from 2021: report

image.altText: A student with dark hair and a blue jumper in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Canberra experienced the slowest quarterly growth in rental values in the country, and the lowest 12-month increase in rent prices for units.

title.children: 'Absurd': Rentals sit vacant at home but here Gabriel can't find one

image.altText: A smartly dressed woman with short hair leaves a court building next to a man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission levels findings of "serious corrupt conduct" against two former Canberra Institute of Technology (CIT) officials over the handling of a controversial $5 million contract.

title.children: CIT officials' actions amounted to 'serious corrupt conduct': watchdog

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The acting justice acknowledged the accused's troubled childhood and recommended that rehabilitation be considered in his sentencing.

title.children: Judge says village responsible for raising car thief 'failed him'

image.altText: Harry Wilson upset after Wallabies' loss to Lions.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies feel they were victims of an unfair refereeing decision during the dramatic final minute of their 29-26 defeat to the British and Irish Lions in the second Test at the MCG.

title.children: 'Gutted' Wallabies fuming after contentious late call in Lions Test loss

image.altText: The arrest warrant pictures all 19 people that are currently wanted.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong authorities have issued arrest warrants for 19 foreign nationals, including Australian and UK citizens, accusing them of national security crimes.

title.children: Hong Kong authorities slap bounty on Australian citizen

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: Mr Trump says he warned leaders of both countries that he would not make trade deals with either of them if the border conflict continued.

title.children: Trump says Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire talks after border clashes

image.altText: A man in a red hard-hat stands in a field of massive solar panels speaking to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Experts say Beijing's commitment to renewable energy is revolutionising the country's energy usage, and it could impact the fight against global warming and a key Australian industry.

title.children: 'The writing is on the wall': China may have reached peak emissions

image.altText: Hands of person using joystick to play video game at home

props.synopsis: Across the internet in recent weeks, influencers, streamers and video game fans have been calling for laws to "stop killing games". This is what to know about the movement.

title.children: Stop Killing Games movement asks if you can ever 'own' digital content

image.altText: A press shot of INXS in the '80s adorned with graphic design of Australian flora.

props.synopsis: Scoring film, TV, sporting events and deeply personal moments, INXS's tender ballad has stood the test time. Now, it's been voted as Australia's hottest song of all time.

title.children: INXS wins the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: 5 men

props.synopsis: Years of speculation followed the case — but after revived investigations amid reports Hockey Canada used players' registration fees to pay sexual abuse settlements, it was reopened and made public.

title.children: Five Canadian ice hockey players have been acquitted of sexual assault. What happened?

image.altText: A woman, man and young son.

props.synopsis: Australians are defying a global downturn in travel to the United States, with new figures showing a rise in visitor numbers, despite Donald Trump's tough new border controls.

title.children: Trump's tough border stance isn't deterring some Australian tourists

image.altText: A black and white image of a bandicoot head and upper body in a brown frame held in two hands with a book shelf background.

props.synopsis: Hidden in the long-forgotten personal archives of a 20th-century anatomist was a pair of images depicting an extinct species of bandicoot with an unusual butterfly pattern and aggressive streak.

title.children: Two precious photos of long-extinct bandicoot found in museum box

image.altText: Sam Mostyn poses for a selfie with primary school students. They're all smiling.

props.synopsis: Vowing to be a modern, optimistic and visible governor-general, Sam Mostyn has adopted a "culture of care" as a key focus of her term. So how has she done that over her first year in the job? And can she help Australia during these polarised times?

title.children: From selfies to service, the governor-general is setting a modern tone

image.altText: A truck seen through a gap in road signs.

props.synopsis: Truckloads of help arrive in SA's Eyre Peninsula from across the Nullarbor in WA as part of a huge logistical, cross-border exercise to deliver thousands of bales of desperately needed hay to farms in the grip of drought.

title.children: Drought relief truck convoy brings fodder to farms in time-honoured tradition

image.altText: Illustration of man using a computer with scam icons overhead

props.synopsis: Many of us receive scam text messages with dubious job offers — but this Australian was waiting to be contacted, and fell into the snare of a task-based scam.

title.children: What happened when Sam responded to a text most would delete

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I hope you've been hitting the books. We both know you needed it. Let's play, HARD!

title.children: I'm back to test your trivia skills. Have you used your time off wisely?

image.altText: A graphic showing a girl sitting in the dock of a courtroom.

props.synopsis: On a Tuesday morning when most kids are at school, a handful of children are waiting to be brought before a judge. This is what a regular week inside the Northern Territory's Youth Justice Court looks like.

title.children: We watched 100 cases in the NT's youth court for a week. Here's what we saw

image.altText: On a red background, blurred images of children can be seen. In the foreground, the word ADVANCE is printed

props.synopsis: Conservative lobby group Advance used unblurred images of children taken from the YouTube accounts of education organisations without their consent, an ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found.

title.children: Parents did not consent to children appearing in new Advance ad

image.altText: A tall metal structure that has swings attached to via chains that elevates people into the sky, while swinging around.

props.synopsis: A teenager is in serious condition after he was stabbed at the Royal Darwin Show, with the alleged offender charged with recklessly endangering life.

title.children: 15yo boy charged after alleged Darwin Show stabbing of another teenager

image.altText: McLaren's Oscar Piastri driving on a race track.

props.synopsis: McLaren's Lando Norris pipped championship-leading teammate Oscar Piastri to pole position at the Belgian Grand Prix on Saturday.

title.children: Piastri narrowly misses out on pole, finishes second in sprint race

image.altText: Trump and Powell looking a sheet of paper

props.synopsis: Video of the US central bank's boss correcting the US president has been compared to a scene from The Office. But it's not scripted comedy.

title.children: Seen the viral video of Trump being fact-checked? Here's the backstory

image.altText: Two men shake hands.

props.synopsis: The United States has lifted sanctions on several allies of Myanmar's ruling generals and their military-linked companies in a move that has prompted concern from politicians and rights groups.

title.children: US drops sanctions on Myanmar junta allies after military praises Trump

image.altText: A crocodile sighting warning sign in front of a brown river.

props.synopsis: The "mighty Fitzroy", in the words of Queensland Premier David Crisafulli, is slated to host rowing and canoeing at the 2032 Olympic Games but sporting bodies have expressed concerns, writes Alex Brewster.

title.children: Queensland premier playing politics over river at centre of Olympic debate

image.altText: Marianne Vos smiles in among a pack of people after a Tour de France stage

props.synopsis: Cycling great Marianne Vos wins the opening stage of the women's Tour de France with a brilliant late attack.

title.children: Dutch great Vos wins opening stage of Tour de France Femmes

image.altText: An ornate double storey homestead with turning circle and gravel driveway and cream fretwork

props.synopsis: A small SA country town hopes a new drama series by global streaming giant Netflix will lead to a boost in tourists.

title.children: Small town hopes Netflix series My Brilliant Career will boost tourism

image.altText: An historic photo of soldiers from world war one sitting in a trench.

props.synopsis: A volunteer-run group is focusing on the remains of more than 200 Australian soldiers who were discovered in a mass grave in France almost two decades ago.

title.children: Volunteers working to identify missing WWI soldiers through DNA testing

image.altText: A man looks down at a sheet of paper and a woman looks at him and smiles

props.synopsis: In an unassuming hall in Hervey Bay, 20 people are belting out classics. The goal of this choir isn't to be pitch perfect — it's to help manage their dementia.

title.children: Music the medicine to manage debilitating condition in regional Queensland

image.altText: A group of women sit around a table covered in fairy tale books

props.synopsis: Fairytales written centuries ago continue to inspire readers, novelists and artists who dabble in "the imagination business".

title.children: Why fairytales still appeal to our imagination, even as adults

image.altText: Three raw lamb chops with fat marbling through them

props.synopsis: An Australian producer develops lamb with a marbling level of at least 7 per cent, with the hope it will one day be treated the same as wagyu beef.

title.children: Look out wagyu, lamb wants a spot at the fine dining table
